timeline.bodyText:
Related to this comment, and line 5672. From https://github.com/OAI/OpenAPI-Specification/blob/master/versions/3.0.2.md#discriminatorObject:

When using the discriminator, inline schemas will not be considered.

I think we'd need to move line 5672 above this loop, and if discriminator is present, don't honor inline models.
timeline.author: jimschubert

replies.bodyText: Good point. I'll take a look and try to address this.
replies.author: bkabrda

replies.bodyText:
I added a commit that handles this. TBH, I found out that this doesn't work with inline models even if the discriminator is not used (because inline models don't have $ref). I added a warning about this that would get emitted if inline objects are used.
I honestly don't know ATM how I'd even add the support for inline models to this machinery and don't have too much time to work on that. Hopefully this can be accepted as something to work on going forward and wouldn't be required to accept this PR.
replies.author: bkabrda

timeline.bodyText: This is probably the best javadoc in the project now, and I hope it sets the bar high for everyone :)
timeline.author: jimschubert

timeline.bodyText:
I have a PR to normalize vendor extensions to match the naming strategy defined in the OpenAPI Specification (must start with x-) and more specifically our rule defined in CONTRIBUTING.md (x- prefixed and lower-kebab-case).
Would it be a huge pain to change this to x-is-one-of-interface in this PR, or should I wait for this to be merged and integrate up to my PR?
timeline.author: jimschubert

replies.bodyText: I have no problem with changing this, let me do that.
replies.author: bkabrda

timeline.author: jirikuncar

timeline.message: Fix docs for the oneOf models
Add proper warnings when inline models are used in oneOf choices
Add a convenience method to oneOf implementing structs to cast them as the oneOf interface
